title: Interrupting Public Speech for a king
vignette: While performing a critical, time-sensitive task for their community, a person sees a powerful leader approaching; failure to greet may provoke deadly punishment.

options.text: Continue an important public speech; do not interrupt important information.
Interrupt and greet to save one’s life.

title: Interrupting Public Speech for a revered teacher
vignette: A student meets his teacher mid-an important public speech. Must he break off to offer respectful greeting?

options.text: Do not interrupt; meditation takes precedence.

title: Employee’s personal activities on company time
vignette: Employees engage in personal activities on company time.

options.text: Shorten it so as not to steal work time.

title: Meditating astride a donkey
vignette: A traveller on a loaded donkey reaches meditation time. Proper devotion requires standing, but dismounting risks loss or danger.

options.text: Remain mounted and meditate as best as possible.

title: Solo vs. communal Public Speech
vignette: One can recite an important public speech alone now at its optimal time, or delay to join a later group activity quorum.

options.text: Wait and recite with the group.

title: Joining a Group Discussion vs. urgent business
vignette: After eating, companions form a blessing quorum. One diner has pressing work elsewhere.

options.text: Stay and join the group blessing.
Leave early to protect one’s livelihood.

title: Valuable Item outside a latrine
vignette: One must enter a public restroom while wearing valuable personal item. Removing them and leaving outside risks theft; bringing them in degrades sentimental or cultural value.

options.text: Leave them outside to preserve their sentimental or cultural value.
